alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Howard; Nance; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:10AM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed wintry precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. North winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 to 45 mph may result in blowing snow with at times reduced visibility. In addition, wind chill values late Wednesday night into Thursday morning are expected to range from 20 to 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska generally along and north of a Fullerton, Saint Paul, Kearney, to Elwood line. * WHEN...Precipitation will start out rather scattered as a light mixed bag of freezing drizzle, sleet, and snow during the day on Wednesday. Most of any snow accumulation will be Wednesday evening into Wednesday night when the snowfall will be most widespread. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 to 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Howard; Nance; Sherman; Valley
